net.sf.mmm.search.indexer.base.config

Class ConfiguredSearchIndexerOptionsBean

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.sf.mmm.search.indexer.base.config.ConfiguredSearchIndexerOptionsBean
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ConfiguredSearchIndexerOptions, SearchIndexerOptions

    public class ConfiguredSearchIndexerOptionsBean
extends Object
implements ConfiguredSearchIndexerOptions
    This is the implementation of ConfiguredSearchIndexerOptions as simple java bean.
    Since:
    1.0.0
    Author:
    Joerg Hohwiller (hohwille at users.sourceforge.net)

    • Method Detail

      • isOptimize

        public boolean isOptimize()
        This method determines if the search-index will be optimized after indexing.
        Specified by:
        isOptimize in interface ConfiguredSearchIndexerOptions
        Returns:
        true if the search-index will be optimized, false otherwise.

      • setOptimize

        public void setOptimize(boolean optimize)
        This method sets the optimize-flag.
        Parameters:
        optimize - is the optimize-flag to set.

      • isOverwriteEntries

        public boolean isOverwriteEntries()
        This method determines if all existing entries for the sources to index shall be deleted from the search-index and (re-)indexed from scratch. If source-IDs are NOT set (null), this is the same as SearchIndexerOptions.isOverwriteIndex().
        Specified by:
        isOverwriteEntries in interface ConfiguredSearchIndexerOptions
        Returns:
        true if existing entries shall be overwritten, false if existing entries shall remain (and will be updated incremental).

      • setOverwriteEntries

        public void setOverwriteEntries(boolean overwriteEntries)
        This method sets the overwriteEntries-flag.
        ATTENTION:
        Be careful with overwriting. Your existing entries will be lost. You may loose valuable data.
        Parameters:
        overwriteEntries - is the overwriteEntries-flag to set.

      • isOverwriteIndex

        public boolean isOverwriteIndex()
        This method determines if a potentially existing indexer shall be overwritten. In this case if the search-index already exists, it will be deleted and all data is lost. If no index exists yet, it will be created in any case.
        Specified by:
        isOverwriteIndex in interface SearchIndexerOptions
        Returns:
        true if the index shall be overwritten, false if an existing index shall remain (and can be updated incremental).

      • getSourceIds

        public List<String> getSourceIds()
        This method gets the optional List of source-IDs that shall be (re-)indexed. If the List is NOT null (default) all sources will be indexed, otherwise sources configured but NOT contained in this List will NOT be indexed.
        Specified by:
        getSourceIds in interface ConfiguredSearchIndexerOptions
        Returns:
        the List of source-IDs or null to index all sources.

      • setSourceIds

        public void setSourceIds(List<String> sourceIds)
        This method sets the source-IDs.
        Parameters:
        sourceIds - is the source-IDs to set.

      • getNonUtfEncoding

        public String getNonUtfEncoding()
        This method gets the non-UTF encoding.
        Specified by:
        getNonUtfEncoding in interface ConfiguredSearchIndexerOptions
        Returns:
        the non-UTF encoding.
        See Also:
        SearchIndexerConfiguration.getNonUtfEncoding()

      • setNonUtfEncoding

        public void setNonUtfEncoding(String nonUtfEncoding)
        Parameters:
        nonUtfEncoding - is the nonUtfEncoding to set
